text: Mark Champion (born August 8, 1950) is the radio voice of the Detroit Pistons. He also called games for the Detroit Fury, Tampa Bay Buccaneers, Detroit Lions, and Michigan State Spartans. Champion also worked for CBS Radio and Westwood One. He was an anchor of Olympics on CBS Radio as well as calling golf tournaments for CBS Radio. Champion was the play-by-play announcer for College Basketball on Westwood One as well as NFL on Westwood One as an announcer for Thanksgiving Classic and a substitute for Sunday doubleheader for Harry Kalas when Kalas was still calling games for the Philadelphia Phillies.
